reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a clean, basic hotel. Nice little shop downstairs to buy snacks and beer. The front desk printed out our directions where we needed to get, and offered us a cab as well.
reviews.title: Nice, bassic, clean hotel.

likes.liked: — Plenty of parking, close to exits

reviews.text: We thought it was closer to the metro, but it wasnt. they were willing to show ushow to get there though.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: The room was clean, but it was so damp from the humidity even with the air conditioner on. The carpet felt very damp. Services were ok. Also, the pool was only open from 10am to 9 or 10pm. The kids were VERY dissapointed about not being able to swim in the morning and by the time we got back from sight-seeing and visiting with relatives, it was too late to swim.
reviews.title: Courtyard, Springfield, VA

reviews.text: Stayed at the Courtyard for 1 night. The hotel is clean, no noise, and very handy for the Autotrain. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Location, quality and price make it a winner
Another terrific stay -- love, love, love this Courtyard!
reviews.text: Springfield is home of the I-95 "Mixing Bowl" - not exactly the sexy destination of hotel choices... BUT... it is very convenient for commuting into DC and gives you far better pricing on hotels. Tops among the area hotels are the two Marriott properties: the Courtyard and the Residence Inn. The Courtyard provides consistent Courtyard quality, and you can often find very good rates.

Quiet & convenient Location, pleasant staff at the Courtyard. Full Breakfast, Dinner and snacks are available. Pleasant staff at the pool & spa. Very well maintained property. I would stay there again on another trip to the Springfield area.
reviews.title: On a business trip? Try the Courtyard
